Analysis.name: Sensitivity analysis: laboratory-confirmed leptospirosis (worst-case scenario)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Some concerns

The eligible subjects were randomised into three groups but there was no detailed information on randomisation. 
There was no information on allocation sequence concealment.
Baseline characteristics were not different and the number of participants in each group were similarly distributed.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk
Both the health care personnels and the participants were blinded. We assumed that modified intention to treat was applied as participants with missing outcomes were not included in the analysis.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support:
2 participants from azithromycin group and 11 from placebo group were lost to follow up. 
No analysis method that correct for bias was used. 
It was mentioned that participants who were lost to follow up left the endemic area, not because of their health status or other issue related with intervention.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo:
ELISA was used .
Same measurement was done for both groups
Health care staff and participants were blind.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Some concerns

Pre-specified plan was available. No changes in the analysis plan. 
IgG and IgM were measured at different time points and results were reported in accordance with the protocol. 
There was no information regarding this.
Overall.bias.support:
The eligible subjects were randomised into three groups but there was no detailed information on randomisation. 
There was no information on allocation sequence concealment.

The trial was randomised, but there was no detailed information on the process of randomisation. 
It was mentioned that drug for each individual for each week was packed in separate packets and labelled but not enough information whether they were opaque. The number of participants in both groups were similar and age group were equally distributed.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Some concerns

Double blinding was mentioned.
Neither the lab personnels nor the participants aware of the intervention group they belonged to. 
But no information whether they blinded carers and the people delivering the interventions. 
It was not reported.

We assumed that modified intention to treat was applied as participants with missing outcomes were not included in the analysis.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support:
24.8% in Group A and 22.7% in Group B were drop out. 
No analytical method that correct bias was used. 
Some missingness of participants could depend on its true value as the reasons for 
withdrawn were non compliance with instructions, medication for other illness, side effects or because they moved out of the area and could not be traced. 
Some missingness of participants could depend on its true value as the reasons for 
withdrawn were non compliance with instructions, medication for other illness, side effects or because they moved out of the area and could not be traced.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo:
There was no information about the method of measurement. 
There was no information about the ascertainment of the outcome between intervention groups. 
There was no information whether outcome assessorswere aware of the intervention received by study participants. 
There was no information whether the assessment of the outcomes was likely to be influenced by the knowledge of intervention received.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Some concerns
Prespecified analysis plan was not availble. No information regarding this.
Overall.bias.support:
The trial was randomised, but there was no detailed information on the process of randomisation. 
It was mentioned that drug for each individual for each week was packed in separate packets and labelled but no enough information whether they were opaque. The number of participants in both groups were similar and age group were equally distributed. Double blinding was mentioned.
Neither the lab personnels nor the participants aware of the intervention group they belonged to. 
But no information whether they blinded carers and the people delivering the interventions. 
It was not reported.

We assumed that modified intention to treat was applied as participants with missing outcomes were not included in the analysis. 24.8% in Group A and 22.7% in Group B were drop out. 
No analytical method that correce bias was used. 
Some missingness of participants could depend on its true value as the reasons for 
withdrawn were non compliance with instructions, medication for other illness, side effects or because they moved out of the area and could not be traced. 
Some missingness of participants could depend on its true value as the reasons for 
withdrawn were non compliance with instructions, medication for other illness, side effects or because they moved out of the area and could not be traced. There was no information about the method of measurement. 
There was no information about the ascertainment of the outcome between intervention groups. 
There was no information whether outcome assessorswere aware of the intervention received by study participants. 
There was no information whether the assessment of the outcomes was likely to be influenced by the knowledge of intervention received. Prespecified analysis plan was not availble. No information regarding this.

Analysis.name: Sensitivity analysis: non-serious adverse events (worst-case scenario)
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Some concerns

Computer generated coding was used. Block randomisation was applied but no information about sequence concealment.

No baseline differences between intervention groups and the number of participants in each group were equal. All volunteers were male soldiers assigned at Fort Sherman.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk

Double blind was mentioned and reported use of identical appearing placebo capsules.

We assumed that modified intention to treat was applied as participants with missing outcomes were not included in the analysis.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support:
There were missing outcome data for 107 participants. 
No statisical analysis that correct for bias was done. 
Participants were removed from the study primarily because they received other antibiotics for unrelated medical problem. 
Participants were removed from the study primarily because they received other antibiotics for unrelated medical problem.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo:
There was no information about the method of measuring the outcome. 
There was no information about the ascertainment of the outcome. 
Double blind was mentioned and reported use of identical appearing placebo capsules.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Some concerns
Prespecified analysis plan was not available. No information regarding this.
Overall.bias.support:
Computer generated coding was used. Block randomisation was applied but no information about sequence concealment.

No baseline differences between intervention groups and the number of participants in each group equal. All volunteer were male soldiers assigned at Fort Sherman. Double blind was mentioned and reported use of identical appearing placebo capsules.

We assumed that modified intention to treat was applied as participants with missing outcomes were not included in the analysis. There were missing outcome data for 107 participants. 
No statisical analysis that correct for bias was done. 
Participants were removed from the study primarily because they received other antibiotics for unrelated medical problem. 
Participants were removed from the study primarily because they received other antibiotics for unrelated medical problem. There was no information about the method of measuring the outcome. 
There was no information about the ascertainment of the outcome. 
Double blind was mentioned and reported use of identical appearing placebo capsules. Prespecified analysis plan was not available. No information regarding this.

Analysis.name: Proportion of people with non-serious adverse events
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Some concerns

The eligible subjects were randomised into three groups but there was no detailed information on randomisation. 
There was no information on allocation sequence concealment.
Baseline characteristics were not different and the number of participants in each group were similarly distributed.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk
Both the health care personnels and the participants were blinded. We assumed that modified intention to treat was applied as participants with missing outcomes were not included in the analysis.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support:
2 participants from azithromycin group and 11 from placebo group were lost to follow up. 
No analysis method that correct for bias was used. 
It was mentioned that participants who were lost to follow up left the endemic area, not because of their health status or other issue related with intervention.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo:
The outcomes were already prespecified. Interview was applied as method of measurement. 
All groups were interviewed and they were measured during drug consumption period. 
Health center staff were blined.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Some concerns

Prespecified plan was available. No changes in the analysis plan. 
Only interview method was applied. 
No information regarding this.
Overall.bias.support:
The eligible subjects were randomised into three groups but there was no detail information on randomisation. 
There was no information on allocation sequence concealment.
Baseline characteristic were not different and the number of participants in each group were planned to similarly distributed. Both the health care personnels and the participants were blinded. We assumed that modified intention to treat was applied as participants with missing outcomes were not included in the analysis. 2 participants from azithromycin group and 11 from placebo group were lost to follow up. 
No analysis method that correct for bias was used. 
It was mentioned that participants who were lost to follow up left the endemic area, not because of their health status or other issue related with intervention. The outcomes were already prespecified. Interview was applied as method of measurement. 
All groups were interviewed and they were measured during drug consumption period. 
Health center staff were blined. Prespecified plan was available. No changes in the analysis plan. 
Only interview method was applied. 
No information regarding this.
